alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 12:42PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern McIntosh, northeastern Okmulgee and northwestern Muskogee Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Morris to 5 miles northwest of Lake Eufaula State Park. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Checotah... Haskell... Morris... Oktaha... Boynton... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Bald Hill... Lake Eufaula State Park... Wainwright... Hitchita... Jamesville... Pierce... Eram... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 250 and 265. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
